intro: Cecropia humboldtiana, commonly known as the giant ceiba, is a towering tree native to the tropical rainforests of Central and South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its massive, buttressed roots and a hollow trunk. The plant has large, palmate leaves that are often covered in a fine, white pubescence. It produces showy, yellow flowers that are followed by woody, three-lobed fruits containing numerous seeds. This species plays a crucial role in its ecosystem, providing habitat and food for various animals.
